headline: Rafael Sanchez Joins Bloomin’ Brands as Chief Information Officer
summary: TAMPA, Fla., June 24, 2025--Bloomin’ Brands, Inc. (Nasdaq: BLMN) announced the appointment of Rafael Sanchez as Senior Vice President & Chief Information Officer. Sanchez joins the company from Davidson Hospitality Group where he served as Senior Vice President of Information Technology. His appointment is effective June 30, 2025.

headline: S&P 500 Stock Carnival Surfs Higher On Earnings, Israel-Iran Hopes
summary: S&P 500 stock Carnival, already riding high as travel stocks rebound on hopes of an Israel-Iran ceasefire, powered higher after cruising past fiscal second-quarter earnings estimates. CCL, other cruise lines and airline stocks, including United Airlines, gapped higher early Tuesday.

summary: Carnival topped quarterly expectations, and posted its largest customer deposit number in history.  Carnival Corp. headline: Carnival Stock Surges After Earnings. Why the Shares Are Getting a Double Boost.
summary: Carnival stock jumped about 9% on Tuesday after investors welcomed the cruise operator’s earnings and a sharp drop in oil prices.  The company also hiked its full-year profit guidance.  Carnival reported adjusted earnings of 35 cents a share, compared with the consensus call by analysts for 25 cents.

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Tesla, Super Micro, Occidental, RTX, FedEx, Carnival, KB Home, and More
summary: Stock futures rose but came off gains and oil prices recouped some losses Tuesday after Israel accused Iran of violating a cease-fire that President Donald Trump had announced just a few hours earlier.  Tesla  rose 2.6% in premarket trading.  The electric-vehicle company jumped 8.2% to $348.71 on Monday following the launch Sunday of its robo-taxi service in Austin, Texas.

Tesla  rose 2.6% in premarket trading.  The electric-vehicle company jumped 8.2% to $348.71 on Monday following the launch Sunday of its robo-taxi service in Austin, Texas.

headline: Carnival’s (NYSE:CCL) Q2: Beats On Revenue, Stock Soars
summary: Cruise ship company Carnival (NYSE:CCL) beat Wall Street’s revenue expectations in Q2 CY2025, with sales up 9.5% year on year to $6.33 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $0.35 per share was 45.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: My 5 Favorite Dirt Cheap Stocks to Buy Right Now
summary: All of these factors -- particularly the import tariff announcements -- have weighed on investors' appetite for stocks.  Alphabet (NASDAQ: GOOG) (NASDAQ: GOOGL) is the cheapest of the "Magnificent Seven" technology stocks that led market gains last year but tumbled this year amid concerns about tariffs and their impact on the economy.  It's the world's No. 1 search engine, and its presence in our daily routine and Alphabet's moves to use artificial intelligence (AI) to continually improve results should help it remain on top.
